content: foot picking up heel flap stitches the chart is sideways so that it can be as big as https //youtu be/6tvtw26ton4 possible continuing the pattern through the toe https //youtu be/mgtzun1hx94 eye of partridge ball of foot once you reach 3 inches from the end of your sock knit in knit stockinette on the top half of your foot and knit ▪ purl the eye of partridge pattern on the bottom round 1 *sl1 k1* until 1st marker knit to next marker round 2 knit round 3 *k1 sl1* until 1st marker knit to next marker round 4 knit repeat rounds 1-4 for 1 ending with whatever row completes the amount of length desired rounded toe optional continue with eye of partridge pattern into the toe until satisfied round 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 repeat round 2 3 and 4 knit round 5 repeat round 1 round 6 and 7 knit round 8 repeat round 1 round 9 and 10 knit round 11 repeat round 1 round 12 knit round 13 repeat round 1 round 14 knit round 15 repeat round 1 round 16 knit continue decrease rounds row 15 until you have 12 stitches between both stitch markers finishing graft your last 24 stitches together with kitchener stitch tread heavy socks for personal use only do not reproduce © 2022 bethany hight yourgreathightness@gmail com afterthought heel round 8 k1 ssk *k1 sl1* to 3 stitches before mark the middle stitch of the row you wish to marker k2tog k1 repeat cut in the heel pick up the right leg of each round 9 knit stitch on the bottom of the foot 28 30 32 34 round 10 as round 2 36 stitches on the row above your stitch round 11 as round 1 marker do the same thing on row below your round 12 as round 2 marked stitch also pull on your marker slightly round 13 as round 1 and cut the single stitch carefully unpick the round 14 as round 2 cut yarn unraveling the row until you have 2 round 15 as round 1 stitches left on both sides as pictured below- round 16 as round 2 round 17 as round 8 round 18 as round 1 round 19 k1 ssk *sl1 k1* to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 repeat round 20 as round 1 continue rounds 17-20 until you have 24 stitches 12 between both stitch markers kitchener remaining stitches leave your yarn tails long and either knit them in as you go or tuck them into your sock hell hole to weave in later place stitch markers in heel corners and choose which side is your bor marker it doesn t matter which one it is it just matters that it remains the same this heel is written through the 72 stitch size whatever size you are knitting stop on the row that leaves you with 24 stitches round 1 k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before
